paper_abstract: The first Zagreb index of a graph G, with vertex set V(C) and edge set E(G), is defined as M-1(G) = Sigma(u is an element of v(G)) d(u)(2) where d(u) denotes the degree of the vertex v. An alternative expression for M, (G) is Sigma(uv is an element of v(G)) [d(u) + d(v) ]. We consider a multiplicative version of M-1 defined as Pi(1)*(G) = Pi(uv is an element of E(G))[d(u) + d(v)]. We prove that among all connected graphs with a given number of vertices, the path has minimal Pi(1)*. We also determine the trees with the second minimal Pi(1)*.
paper_title: Multiplicative Versions of First Zagreb Index
